message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
Map.Entry<Integer,Integer> entry = testMap.entrySet().iterator().next();
Integer key = entry.getKey();
Integer value = entry.getValue();
<<<explanation>>>: HashMaps in Java don't have a built-in method to get the first or second element because they don't maintain a consistent order. However, you can use an Iterator to access the elements. The entrySet() method returns a set view of the mappings contained in this map. The iterator() method returns an iterator over the elements in this set. The next() method returns the next element in the iteration. Then you can use getKey() and getValue() to access the key and value of the entry.
